sen.j: 敦康親王（あつやす しんのう、長保元年11月7日 (旧暦)（999年12月17日） - 寛仁2年12月17日 (旧暦)（1019年1月25日））は平安時代中期の皇族。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Atsuyasu (December 17, 999 - January 25, 1019) was a member of the Imperial family who lived in the mid-Heian Period.
Prince Atsuyasu (December 17, 999 - January 25, 1019) was a member of the Imperial family who lived in the mid-Heian Period.
Imperial Prince Atsuyasu (December 22, 999 - January 31, 1019) was a member of the Imperial family who lived in the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: Imperial Prince Atsuyasuに修正、Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更December 17→December 22に変更しました。January 25→January 31に変更しました。

sen.j: 第66代一条天皇を父に、中宮藤原定子を母として、長保元年（999年）中宮大進平生昌邸において誕生。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was born to the Emperor Ichijo (the 66th Emperor) and FUJIWARA no Teishi, who was the Chugu (the second consort of an emperor) at that time, in 999 at the residence of TAIRA no Narimasa, who served as Chugu-no-Daishin (a sixth rank post in the Office of the Empress's Household).

Prince Atsuyasu was born in 999 to Emperor Ichijo (the 66th Emperor) and FUJIWARA no Teishi, who was the then Chugu (the second consort of an emperor), at the residence of TAIRA no Narimasa, who served as Chugu-no-Daishin (a sixth rank post in the Office of the Empress's Household).
sen.cmt: The date seemed (to me) to be a little too far removed from the verb so I moved it to make this read a little more smoothly.
sen.e: Prince Atsuyasu was born in 999 to Emperor Ichijo (the 66th Emperor) and FUJIWARA no Teishi, who was the then Chugu (the second consort of an emperor), at the residence of TAIRA no Narimasa, who served as Chugu no Daishin (a sixth rank post in the Office of the Empress's Household).

sen.j: 后腹の第一皇子であった。
sen.e: He was the first prince born by a consort of the Emperor.

sen.e: He was the first prince born to a consort of the Emperor.

sen.j: しかし、当時外祖父・中関白藤原道隆は既になく、また伯父藤原伊周の失脚で母の実家は没落し力を失っていた。
sen.e: However, the family in which his mother was born ruined and lost power before his birth because of the death of FUJIWARA no Michitaka (also known as Nakanokanpaku), his maternal grandfather, as well as the downfall of FUJIWARA no Korechika, his uncle.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However, because of the death of FUJIWARA no Michitaka (also known as Nakanokanpaku), his maternal grandfather, as well as the downfall of FUJIWARA no Korechika, his uncle, the family into which his mother was born had already fallen into ruin and lost influence before he was born.

However, because of the death of FUJIWARA no Michitaka (also known as Nakanokanpaku), his maternal grandfather, as well as the downfall of FUJIWARA no Korechika, his uncle, the family into which his mother was born had already fallen into ruin and lost influence before he was born.

sen.j: しかも敦康の誕生と同日に権力者藤原道長女藤原彰子が女御宣下を受けており、不運の宿世を背負っての出生であった。
sen.e: In addition, FUJIWARA no Shoshi, the eldest daughter of FUJIWARA no Michinaga, who was powerful, received an Imperial letter of appointment as Nyogo (court lady next in rank to the Chugu) on the same day Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was born; thus, he was born, destined to live an unfortunate life.
sen.cmt: 「藤原道長女藤原彰子」：「藤原道長の長女藤原彰子」の誤植と判断しました。
sen.e: Moreover, FUJIWARA no Shoshi, eldest daughter of the powerful courtier FUJIWARA no Michinaga, received an Imperial letter of appointment as Nyogo (a court lady next in rank to Chugu) on the same day that Prince Atsuyasu was born, meaning that he was destined to lead an unhappy life from birth.

Moreover, FUJIWARA no Shoshi, eldest daughter of the powerful courtier FUJIWARA no Michinaga, received an Imperial letter of appointment as Nyogo (a court lady next in rank to Chugu) on the same day that Prince Atsuyasu was born, meaning that he was destined to lead an unhappy life from birth.

sen.j: 誕生翌年の長保2年（1000年）4月18日、親王となるが、同年末、二歳で母后を失った。
sen.e: He became an Imperial prince on April 18 of the following 1000; however, at the end of the same year, he lost his mother, who was the Empress, at the age of two.
He became an Imperial prince on April 18 of the following year, 1000; however, at the end of the same year, he lost his mother, the Empress, at the age of two.
He became an Imperial prince on May 30 of the following year, 1000; however, at the end of the same year, he lost his mother, the Empress, at the age of two.

sen.j: その後、母后の末妹（御匣殿 (藤原道隆四女)）が母代として宮中で親王とその姉妹の内親王方を養育したが、ほどなく没した。
sen.e: Thereafter, the youngest sister of the late Empress (Mikushigedono (the fourth daughter of FUJIWARA no Michitaka)) brought up Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and his sisters (Imperial princesses) in place of the late Empress; however, Mikushigedono died soon.

sen.e: The youngest sister of the late Empress (Mikushigedono (the fourth daughter of FUJIWARA no Michitaka)) then assumed responsibility for raising the Prince Atsuyasu and his sisters (Imperial princesses) in place of the late Empress; however, Mikushigedono died soon thereafter.

The youngest sister of the late Empress (Mikushigedono (the fourth daughter of FUJIWARA no Michitaka)) then assumed responsibility for raising the Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and his sisters (Imperial princesses) in place of the late Empress; however, Mikushigedono died soon thereafter.

sen.j: そのため、父帝の配慮でまだ子がいなかった中宮彰子に養育が託され、彰子の局飛香舎に移る。
sen.e: In these circumstances, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and his sisters were committed to the care of Shoshi, who was the Chugu and had no children, through the good offices of the Emperor, his father; therefore, they moved to Higyosha, Shoshi's apartment.

Under these circumstances, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and his sisters were committed to the care of Shoshi, who was the Chugu and had no children of her own at that time, through the good offices of the Emperor, his father; therefore, they moved to Higyosha, Shoshi's apartment.

sen.j: 長保3年（1001年）11月13日、同所にて着袴。
sen.e: On November 13, 1001, he wore a hakama for the first time at the ceremony to celebrate his growth, which was held at the apartment.
On November 13, 1001, he put on a hakama for the first time in celebrating the ceremony for Imperial princes known as Chakko no gi, which was held at the apartment.
On December 6, 1001, he put on a hakama for the first time in celebrating the ceremony for Imperial princes known as Chakko no gi, which was held at the apartment.

sen.j: 同年、天皇側近の藤原行成が親王家の勅別当に任命された。
sen.e: In the same year, FUJIWRA no Yukinari, who was an aide to the Emperor, was appointed to act as Chokubetto (a steward at an Imperial prince's family or the like appointed by Imperial order) at the family of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu.

In the same year, FUJIWRA no Yukinari, who was an aide to the Emperor, was appointed to act as Chokubetto (a steward to an Imperial prince's family or the like, by Imperial order) for the family of Prince Atsuyasu.

In the same year, FUJIWRA no Yukinari, who was an aide to the Emperor, was appointed to act as Chokubetto (a steward to an Imperial prince's family or the like, by Imperial order) for the family of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu.

sen.j: 中宮彰子は親王を愛情を込めて育てたが、その父道長においては全く別の意味で親王に奉仕していた。
sen.e: The Chugu Shoshi brought up Imperial Prince Atsuyasu affectionately, and her father, Michinaga, served him in an absolutely different way.
Though the Chugu Shoshi brought up Prince Atsuyasu affectionately, her father, Michinaga, served him in an completely different manner.

sen.e: Though the Chugu Shoshi brought up Imperial Prince Atsuyasu affectionately, her father, Michinaga, served him in an completely different manner.

sen.j: 道長はかつて親王の外舅伊周・藤原隆家兄弟を失脚させた張本人であり、親王の生母定子に対しても数々の非礼を働いた。
sen.e: In earlier days, Michinaga led a plot to cause Korechika (father-in-law of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu) and FUJIWARA no Takaie, who were brothers, to lose their positions, as well as conducted many acts offensive to Teishi, the mother of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu.
sen.cmt: 「親王の外舅伊周」：文字どおりに"father-in-law of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu"と訳出しましたが、この記述はB8の記述と矛盾しています。B8では、伊周は親王の伯父と記述されています。→「外舅」には「母の兄弟。母方の伯叔父。」という意味もあります。
sen.e: In earlier days, Michinaga had instigated a plot leading to the downfall of Korechika (father-in-law of Prince Atsuyasu) and FUJIWARA no Takaie, who were brothers, and commited many offensive acts against Teishi, Prince Atsuyasu's mother.
sen.cmt: To write what you corrected in this comment columns is required.
sen.e: In earlier days, Michinaga had instigated a plot leading to the downfall of FUJIWARA no Korechika and FUJIWARA no Takaie (brothers who were uncles to Imperial Prince Atsuyasu) and acted discourteously towards Teishi, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu's mother, on a number of occasions.
sen.cmt: Imperial Prince Atsuyasuとしました。「外舅」には「母の兄弟。母方の伯叔父。」という意味もあるということと、藤原伊周と藤原隆家が兄弟であることから、左のように修正しました。ご確認いただけますでしょうか。No.35もご確認願います。

sen.j: 彼にとって、敦康親王はあくまで彰子に皇子誕生がなかった時の保険に過ぎなかった。
sen.e: Michinaga intended to have Imperial Prince Atsuyasu succeed to the throne only in the case of nonexistence of Imperial prince born by Shoshi.
sen.cmt: 「彰子に皇子誕生がなかった時の保険に過ぎず」：文字どおりに訳出しても意味を成さないので、「彰子が皇子を生まなかった場合にのみ、敦康親王が皇位を継承する」と読み替えて訳出しました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: To Michinaga, Prince Atsuyasu was no more than an insurance policy who would only succeed to the throne in the event that Shoshi not give birth to an Imperial prince.
sen.cmt: To write what you corrected in this comment columns is required.
sen.e: To Michinaga, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was no more than an insurance policy who would only succeed to the throne should Shoshi not give birth to an Imperial prince.

sen.j: そのため、寛弘5年（1008年）9月、彰子に第二皇子敦成親王（のちの後一条天皇）が生まれるとたちまち道長は敦康親王への奉仕を放棄し、ひたすら外孫の立坊・即位を望むようになる。
sen.e: Therefore, Michinaga gave up serving Imperial Prince Atsuyasu immediately after Shoshi bore the second Imperial Prince, i.e., Imperial Prince Atsunari, who became the Emperor Goichijo later, in September 1008, and came to enthusiastically desire the formal installation as Crown Prince and enthronement of this grandson born by his daughter.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Accordingly, immediately after Shoshi gave birth to the second Imperial Prince, Prince Atsunari (who was to become the Emperor Goichijo) in September 1008, Michinaga abondoned his service to Prince Atsuyasu and, and focused all of his efforts on having his grandson by Shoshin installed as Crown Prince and aceed to the throne.

Accordingly, immediately after Shoshi gave birth to the second Imperial Prince, Prince Atsunari (who was to become the Emperor Goichijo) in September 1008, Michinaga abondoned his service to Imperial Prince Atsuyasu and, and focused all of his efforts on having his grandson by Shoshi installed as Crown Prince and aceed to the throne.

sen.j: 寛弘7年（1010年）1月29日、伯父伊周が失意のうちに薨去。
sen.e: On January 29, 1010, Korechika, his uncle, died a disappointed man.
On January 29, 1010, Korechika, his uncle, died ain despair, a dejected man.
On February 21, 1010, Korechika, his uncle, died ain despair, a dejected man.

sen.j: 政治力を持たなかったとはいえ、正二位准大臣の高位にあった伯父の死は、もともと後見に恵まれない敦康親王の立場をさらに薄弱なものにした。
sen.e: The death of his uncle, who had no political power but was in a high position (specifically, held the office of Vice Minister at the second rank in the hierarchy of the government), resulted in the position of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, who had never been under guardianship, becoming more vulnerable.

The death of his uncle, who had no political power but held a high position (i.e., the office of Vice Minister, at the second rank in the government hierarchy), making the position of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, who had never enjoyed the benefit of a strong backer,even more vulnerable.

The death of his uncle, who had no political power but held a high position (i.e., the office of Vice Minister, at Shonii (Senior Second Rank) in the government hierarchy), making the position of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, who had never enjoyed the benefit of a strong backer, even more vulnerable.
sen.cmt: 正二位→統一リストの表記に修正、スペース追加

sen.j: 同年7月17日、親王は道長の加冠により元服し、三品太宰帥に任ぜられた。
sen.e: On July 17 of the same year, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu had the ceremony of manhood with Michinaga acting as master of the ceremony, and was appointed as Dazai-no-sotsu(Director of Dazaifu (Kyushu branch government)) at Sanbon (the third rank of an Imperial prince)

On July 17 of the same year, Prince Atsuyasu celebrated his coming of age ceremony, presided over by Michinaga acting, and was appointed as Dazai-no-sotsu(Director of Dazaifu (Kyushu branch government)) at Sanbon (the third rank of an Imperial prince)

On September 4 of the same year, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu celebrated his coming of age ceremony, presided over by Michinaga acting, and was appointed as Dazai no sochi (Governor-General of the Dazai-fu, Kyushu branch government) at Sanbon (the third rank of an Imperial prince)
sen.cmt: Imperial Prince Atsuyasuとし、「太宰帥」の表記を修正July 17→September 4に変更しました。

sen.j: 翌寛弘8年（1011年）6月2日、一品准后に叙せられ年官年爵を賜う。
sen.e: On June 2 of the following 1011, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was appointed as Jugo (a title established specifically for preferential treatment of a close relative of the Emperor, or a regent, the chief advisor of the Emperor, the Prime Minister or any other person who rendered distinguished services) at Ippon (the first rank of an Imperial prince), and granted a right called 'nenkan' (a right granted as a stipend to members of the Imperial family (including the emperor), consorts of the emperor, some Court nobles, and so forth to nominate a person for a certain government post conferred to them on the occasion of the annual installation of them as government officials) as well as a right called 'nenshaku' (a right granted as a stipend to a retired emperor, the mother of the Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager, the Empress, and so forth to nominate a person for a certain rank conferred to them on the occasion of the annual conferment of a rank to them).

On June 2 of the following year, 1011, Prince Atsuyasu was appointed as Jugo (a title established specifically for preferential treatment of a close relative of the Emperor, the regent (chief advisor to the Emperor), the Prime Minister, or other person who has rendered distinguished services) at Ippon (the first rank of an Imperial prince), and granted a right called a 'nenkan' (the right to receive an annual stipend and which is granted to members of the Imperial family (including the emperor), consorts of the emperor, select Court nobles, and so forth in nominating a person for a certain government post to be conferred on them on the occasion of the annual government official appointment ceremony) as well as a right called 'nenshaku' (the right to receive an annual stipend and which is granted to a retired emperor, the mother of the Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager, the Empress, and so forth in nominating a person for a certain rank to be conferred on them on the occasion of the annual conferment of rank ceremony).

On July 11 of the following year, 1011, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was appointed as Jugo (a title established specifically for preferential treatment of a close relative of the Emperor, the regent (chief advisor to the Emperor), the Prime Minister, or other person who has rendered distinguished services) at Ippon (the first rank of an Imperial prince), and granted a right called a 'nenkan' (the right to receive an annual stipend and which is granted to members of the Imperial family (including the emperor), consorts of the emperor, select Court nobles, and so forth in nominating a person for a certain government post to be conferred on them on the occasion of the annual government official appointment ceremony) as well as a right called 'nenshaku' (the right to receive an annual stipend and which is granted to a retired emperor, the mother of the Empress Dowager, the Empress Dowager, the Empress, and so forth in nominating a person for a certain rank to be conferred on them on the occasion of the annual conferment of rank ceremony).
sen.cmt: Imperial Prince Atsuyasuとしました。June 2→July 11に変更しました。

sen.j: 行成は執政者道長の賛成が得難く政変の可能性まであるとした上で、親王の母后の外戚家高階氏が伊勢の伊勢神宮に憚る所ありと言い、極力諌止した。
sen.e: Yukinari said that it was impossible to receive approval from Michinaga, who held the office of an administrator, that the installation of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu as Crown Prince, if realized, might cause a coup d'etat, and that the Takashina clan, which was maternal relatives of the late Empress, the mother of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, was afraid to visit Ise-jingu Grand Shrine located in Ise, and dissuaded the Emperor Ichijo from the installation of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu as Crown Prince to the maximum extent possible.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Yukinari replied that it would be impossible to receive approval from Michinaga, who held the powerful office of administrator, and that if Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was succesfully installed as Crown Prince, it might even result in political turmoil leading to a coup; furthermore, he stated that members of the Takashina clan, which was the maternal clan of the late Empress, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu's mother, were afraid to visit Ise-jingu Grand Shrine located in Ise, and did their utmost to dissuade Emperor Ichijo from installating Imperial Prince Atsuyasu as Crown Prince.
sen.cmt: The term "administrator" is not specific enough nor does it convey the power that enabled him to manipulate the entire government.
sen.e: Yukinari replied that it would be impossible to receive approval from Michinaga, who held the powerful office of administrator, and that if Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was succesfully installed as Crown Prince, it might even result in political turmoil leading to a coup; furthermore, he stated that members of the Takashina clan, which was the maternal clan of the late Empress, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu's mother, were afraid to visit Ise-jingu Grand Shrine located in Ise, and did their utmost to dissuade Emperor Ichijo from installating Imperial Prince Atsuyasu as Crown Prince.

sen.j: このため、敦康親王叙一品の十日後、一条天皇譲位で皇太子に立てられたのはわずか四歳の異母弟敦成親王であった。
sen.e: For this reason, Imperial Prince Atsunari, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu's younger brother by a different mother, was made the heir apparent to the throne at the age of only 4 on the occasion of abdication of the Emperor Ichijo, which took place 10 days after the conferment of the rank of Ippon to Imperial Prince Atsuyasu.

Because this was against the norm, it is said that the by and large the sympathies of the people were secretly on the side of this unfortunate Imperial prince.

sen.j: 長和2年（1013年）12月10日、後中書王具平親王の次女を娶る。
sen.e: On December 10, 1013, Imperial Prince Atsuyasu married the second daughter of Imperial Prince Tomohira, who was commonly known as Nochinochushoo.
On December 10, 1013, Prince Atsuyasu married the second daughter of Imperial Prince Tomohira, who usually went by the name Nochinochushoo.
On January 19, 1014, Prince Atsuyasu married the second daughter of Imperial Prince Tomohira, who usually went by the name Nochinochushoo.

sen.j: 長和5年（1016年）1月29日、式部卿に転じた。
sen.e: On January 29, 1016, he was assigned to the post of Director of the Minister in charge of ceremonies.
On January 29, 1016, he was assigned to the post of Director of the Minister of Ceremonies.
On March 16, 1016, he was assigned to the post of Shikibukyo (Director of the Minister of Ceremonies).
sen.cmt: 「式部卿」の表記を修正January 29→March 16に変更しました。

sen.j: 寛仁2年（1018年）12月17日、にわかに発病し、出家の後没す。
sen.e: On December 17, 1018, he was suddenly attacked with a disease, became a priest thereafter, and then passed away.
On December 17, 1018, he suddenly fell ill, and then took the tonsure to become a Buddhist priest before passing away.
On January 31, 1019, he suddenly fell ill, and then took the tonsure to become a Buddhist priest before passing away.
He was 20 years old.
He was 20 years old.
He was 20 years old.

sen.j: 親王は道長の嫡男摂政藤原頼通と親しく、合婿となり家を共にしていた（親王妃は婚姻前には一時頼通夫妻が養育していたともいう）。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was intimate with FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, who was Michinaga's eldest son and served as regent, and their wives were sisters; therefore, they lived together (some say that the Imperial princess was brought up by Yorimichi and his wife for a while before marriage).

Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was close friends with FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, who was Michinaga's eldest son and served as regent, and their wives were sisters; therefore, they shared the same residence (some say that Imperial Prince Atsuyasu's daughter, the Imperial princess, was brought up by Yorimichi and his wife for a time before her marriage).
sen.cmt: The cultural background as to why they lived in the same house, i.e., the house of the family of their wives, needs explanation.
sen.e: Imperial Prince Atsuyasu was close friends with FUJIWARA no Yorimichi, who was Michinaga's eldest son and served as regent, and their wives were sisters; therefore, they shared the same residence (some say that Imperial Prince Atsuyasu's wife, the Imperial princess, was brought up by Yorimichi and his wife for a time before her marriage).
sen.cmt: 「親王妃」は親王の娘ではなく妻であるため、Imperial Prince Atsuyasu's daughter→Imperial Prince Atsuyasu's wifeとしました。

sen.j: 没後、親王妃は出家し、残された一女は頼通・源隆姫夫婦に引き取られ、大切に育てられた。
sen.e: After the death of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, the Imperial princess became a nun and left her only daughter, and Yorimichi and his wife, MINAMOTO no Takahime, took charge of her and brought her up with great care.

After the death of Imperial Prince Atsuyasu, the Imperial princess became a nun and left her only daughter in the care of Yorimichi and his wife, MINAMOTO no Takahime, who brought her up with great care.

sen.j: のちに後朱雀天皇に入内する藤原げん子である。
sen.e: The said daughter was FUJIWARA no Genko, who entered the Imperial Palace to be a consort of the Emperor Gosuzaku.
The said daughter was FUJIWARA no Genko, who was later to enter the Imperial Palace as a consort of Emperor Gosuzaku.
